description: From Middle English oddenesse; equivalent to odd +‎ -ness.

entries.meaning: (uncountable) The state or quality of being odd.
(countable) The result or product of being odd.
examples: This humour broke out at first in many little oddnesses: he had never any stated hours for his dinner, supper, or sleep; because, said he, we ought to attend the calls of nature, and not set our appetites to our meals  […]
